content.title: Internship Programme Of The Department Of Expenditure
content.details: The Internship Programme of the Department of Expenditure aims to familiarize willing and eligible undergraduates pursuing five-year integrated courses and Graduates pursuing post-Graduation/ post-Graduates pursuing Research with the overall process of formulation of economic policies of the Government. The internship is neither a job nor any such assurance for a job in the Department of Expenditure.
benefits: Token Remuneration @ ₹ 10,000/- per month per intern
Certificates will be issued to the interns on satisfactory completion of their internship
eligibility: Indian national pursuing postgraduation Research Courses in Economics/Finance/Management
Students pursuing post-graduate courses should have obtained a first-class Graduate degree
Research Scholars Pursuing courses in Economics/Finance/Management, should have obtained at least 50% marks in Post-Graduation
Students in the 5th year of the 5-year integrated Law course should have obtained at least 80% marks in their 12th Class examination
content.application_process: Interested and eligible students are to send their applications, along with their CVs in the enclosed proforma to Section Officer (Admn-l), Department of Expenditure, Room No.264-B, North Block, New Delhi.
documents_required: A write-up, in their own hand and duly signed, not exceeding 500 words, on why they would consider this programme useful and how it fits in with their career growth
A Report/Paper on the allotted subject at the end of the internship
Mandatory feedback on their experience of the Programme

faqs.question: How Are Interns Selected For The Program?
faqs.answer: The applications will be scrutinized by a Selection Committee, and offers will be sent to selected interns based on slot availability, consent of the concerned division, and approval of the Selection Committee.

faqs.question: Will Interns Receive A Certificate Upon Completion Of The Internship?
faqs.answer: Yes, certificates will be issued to interns upon satisfactory completion of their internship and submission of their report/paper.

faqs.question: Is There A Feedback Process For Interns?
faqs.answer: Yes, interns will be required to provide feedback on their experience of the program.

faqs.question: What Is The Submission Requirement For Interns?
faqs.answer: Interns will be required to present a report/paper on the allotted subject at the end of the internship.

faqs.question: How Will The Placement Of Interns Be Decided?
faqs.answer: Interns will be attached to one of the DS/Director level officers in different divisions of the Department of Expenditure, based on their areas of interest and the preferences of the divisions.

faqs.question: What Support Will Be Provided To The Interns?
faqs.answer: Interns will be provided with necessary logistics support, including office space and a computer with internet facilities.

faqs.question: Are Interns Required To Sign A Declaration Of Secrecy?
faqs.answer: Yes, interns will be required to furnish a declaration of secrecy to the Department before reporting for the internship.

faqs.question: Will Interns Receive Any Remuneration?
faqs.answer: Yes, interns will receive a token remuneration of ₹10,000 per month.

faqs.question: What Is The Duration Of The Internship?
faqs.answer: The duration of the internship can range from two to six months at different points during the financial year.
